DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of tissue that was submitted for assessment of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the description for the sample of cells with similar specialized characteristics used for assessment of disease by a specialist in cellular and tissue function and changes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98):is an organ part that consists of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to specific spatial relationships; together with other tissues, it constitutes an organ component. Example(s): epithelium, muscle(tissue), connective tissue, neural tissue, lymphoid tissue.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to make compliant with updates to ISO and EVS terms

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a description for the origin (type or location within the body) of a sample of tissue used for assessment of disease by a specialist in cellular and tissue function and changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: curated new from existing for theradex. 5/11/18 LS
